tr.td: Birth date of the Patient. YYYY-MM-DD (?) TODO.
Gender of the named Patient. Enumerated Values: [M - male, F - female, O - other].
User or equipment generated Study identifier.
A RIS generated number that identifies the order for the Study.
Name of the Patient's referring physician
Institution-generated description or classification of the Study (component) performed.
Information about the study for which this data was acquired if any.
Unique identifier of the Series. (Series Instance UID?) TODO

Patient position descriptor relative to the equipment. [HFP - Head First-Prone, HFS - Head First-Supine, HFDR - Head First-Decubitus Right, HFDL - Head First-Decubitus Left, FFP - Feet First-Prone, FFS - Feet First-Supine, FFDR - Feet First-Decubitus Right, FFDL - Feet First-Decubitus Left]
A number that identifies this Series. (Series Number?) TODO
User-defined description of the conditions under which the Series was performed.
Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. E.g. "PET fusion". (?) TODO
Instance UID of Related Series. (Series Instance UID?) TODO
Identification of Series significantly related to this Series. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. (?) TODO
Unique identifier of the Series. (Series Instance UID?) TODO
Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.
Other images significantly related to this image.
General information about this measurement and its relation to other measurements.
Manufacturer's model name of the device.
Reciprocal of the total sampling period, in hertz per pixel. (?) TODO
Count of coils used for this measurement.
List of the coils used for this measurement.
Institution where the equipment that produced the Composite Instances is located.
User defined name identifying the machine that produced the Composite Instances.
General information about the acquisition system.
The resonance frequency in Hz of hydrogen in the static magnetic field of this scanner.
Image extent encoded in k-space in pixels.
Image extent encoded in k-space in mm.
Description of the image extent in k-space.
Description of the image extent after reconstruction.
Information about the limit values of the loop counters along the encoded dimensions.
Enum describing the type of this trajectory. Values are: [cartesian, epi, radial, goldenangle, spiral, other"]
Space to describe a trajectory with a number of long integers.
Space to describe a trajectory with a number of double precision floats.
User defined comment on this trajectory.
Description of the k-space trajectory used in this measurement.
The factor of undersampling applied in two encoding directions.
Enum describing which scheme was used to acquire calibration data. Values are: [embedded, interleaved, separate, external, other]
Enum describing which dimension was interleaved. Values are: [phase, repetition, contrast, average, other] TODO
Parameters specific to parallel imaging techniques.
Number of lines in k-space acquired per excitation of the same volume regardless of the type of echo or the number of frames derived from them.
Information how the measured data is layed out in k-space.
The period of time in msec between the beginning of a pulse sequence and the beginning of the succeeding (essentially identical) pulse sequence.

Time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced (kx=0). In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the middle of the excitation pulse to the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space (i.e., -kx=0, ky=0).
Time in msec after the middle of inverting RF pulse to middle of excitation pulse to detect the amount of longitudinal magnetization. Required if Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) has values of IR.
Steady state angle in degrees to which the magnetic vector is flipped from the magnetic vector of the primary field.
Identification of spatial data encoding scheme. Values: [1D, 2D, 3D]. (?) TODO

Time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced (kx=0). In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the middle of the excitation pulse to the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space (i.e., -kx=0, ky=0). (?) TODO
Space to describe additional values with a number of long integers.
Space to describe additional values with a number of double precision floats.
Space to describe additional values with a number of strings.
Space to describe additional values as base64 encoded binary blob.
Space to describe additional user defined parameters.
Name of an instance of waveform information.
Enum describing the type of waveform. Values: [ecg, pulse, respiratory, trigger, gradientwaveform, other]
Space to describe waveform values with a number of long integers.
Space to describe waveform values with a number of double precision floats.
Space to describe waveform values with a number of strings.
Space to describe waveform values with a number of base64 encoded binary data.
Space to describe the actual data of the Waveforms.
